name: kensington tote bag
notes:
tunisian crochet beginners rejoice! this casual tote bag works up quicker than you’d think. it’s made in just one piece using a large hook and super bulky wool-blend yarn. bring it along for trips to the farmers’ market or use it to securely hold your laptop when working on the go.

the “dipped” color-block look is one of my favorite techniques
for adding minimalist style without having to do complicated
colorwork. this tote is made using the tunisian knit stitch. it
looks just like knitting, but it has a sturdier build that will stand
up to whatever you need to tote around.

stitches and techniques
• tunisian knit stitch
• changing colors (stripes)
• adding length in tunisian crochet
• picking up stitches
• mattress stitch seam

yarn
lion brand wool-ease® thick
& quick (80% acrylic, 20% wool), category 6—super bulky weight, 106 yds (97 m)/170 g
(6 oz). 
-(a) succulent, 85 yds (78 m), (1 skein)
-(b) fisherman, 175 yds (160 m), (2 skeins)
